thread.title: Woman's fingertip bitten off during fight over shoes in Delray, police say
thread.title_full: Woman's fingertip bitten off during fight over shoes in Delray, police say

author: Adam Sacasa
title: Woman's fingertip bitten off during fight over shoes in Delray, police say
text:
Woman's fingertip bitten off during fight over shoes in Delray, police say Gelisa Riddles Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office Gelisa Riddles, 28, of Delray Beach, was arrested Sunday for biting off the tip of a woman's finger during an argument over shoes. Gelisa Riddles, 28, of Delray Beach, was arrested Sunday for biting off the tip of a woman's finger during an argument over shoes. (Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office) Adam Sacasa police said.
The fight happened in the front yard of a home along the 100 block of Southwest 11th Avenue shortly before 8 p.m. on Feb. 15. Sharmeize Lillie, 47, of Delray Beach , told investigators that a woman she knows, Gelisa Riddles, 28, was in a chair on the lawn and attacked her when she tried to look behind her for a pair of shoes, an arrest report said. 
Riddles popped up from the chair, grabbed Lillie by the hair, bit her forehead and ---when Lillie tried to push her away--- chomped down on the index finger of her right hand, biting the tip off, Lillie told investigators. 
Lillie was treated for her injuries at a hospital. When reached by telephone Thursday, she refused comment. 
It’s not clear why the two women were arguing about the shoes or why the confrontation became violent. 
Riddles has a history of run-in’s with the law. State records show convictions in 2009 and 2015 on various drug, prostitution and theft charges. 
In the current case, Riddles faces an aggravated battery charge and was being held in the Palm Beach County Jail on $20,000 bond.
